channel.title: Easiest way to
channel.description:
What's the easiest way to get a list like this: [code] aaaaaaaaaa abaaaaaaaa aabaaaaaaa etc. [/code]
Anyone know?

item.title: Easiest way to
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

wtf is up with brute forcing? unless you have like maybe 20 pc’s working together trying different sequences on the same username then it is going to take millenia to actually crack anything.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xSignal xSignal
item.description:
@xSignal wrote:

I am brute forcing -.- But I want it to guess everything possible. I made the program and it seemed to work on some samples, but I’m trying to get into to http://icebox.clubpenguin.com

Read full topic

item.title: Easiest way to
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:17, topic:11124”][quote author=BobDole81 link=topic=16507.msg193802#msg193802 date=1156824364]

cough* brute forcing *cough…
and i doubt you will be able to get a .txt file with that in… because it will be im geussing maybe more then 100gb (no jokes), the only way you could make a brute forcer do that is if you made a script that created that word…

He’s right about the size on that thing, it would prolly be bigger than that actually…

100GB for that? Nah…

You’d be surprised.

Dumping all combinations for an 8 char string using just the 26 lowercase characters is 26^8 = 208827064576 possibilities…multiply by 9 (8 characters written and one newline separator) = 1879443581184 raw bytes = 1.709 tb

I would recommend just using a brute force method or a wordlist

Your math is good, but not good enough. There are 10 characters in his string. ;D

Googling some of your math has give me one life goal I won’t ever achieve. Get/find a Brontobyte HD.

I counted the chars scotty’s scar script, and assumed it would be the same as the main post lol

But then for 10 chars, it would be 1.379 pb (petabytes) = 1412.28 tb
[/quote]

1412.28 tb = 1.354 exabytes. :)[/quote]

I’m pretty sure its petabytes…
kilobyte = 2^10 bytes
megabyte = 2^20 bytes
gigabyte = 2^30 bytes
terabyte = 2^40 bytes
petabyte = 2^50 bytes
exabyte = 2^60 bytes

[quote=“xSignal, post:18, topic:11124”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=16507.msg191912#msg191912 date=1156778414]
bruteforcing like that isnt a good way to go about it

in fact, bruteforcing a login form isnt the best way to go about it either

if you were able to get the hash of the password (assuming unsalted) you would be better off to use rainbow tables though you are probably using this for runescape and will be ip banned
[/quote]

It’s actually something I’m using to get past a password protected area :)[/quote]
Brute forcing is still a better option than creating a list

Read full topic

item.title: Easiest way to
item.dc:creator: @xSignal xSignal
item.description:
@xSignal wrote:

[quote="-SCOTTY-, post:7, topic:11124"]Here ya go just select the window and press play

begin Activateclient Repeat sendkeys('AAAAAAAA ') Sendkeys(Chr(13)) Sleep(50) sendkeys('ABAAAAAA') Sendkeys(Chr(13)) Sleep(50) sendkeys('AABAAAAA') Sendkeys(Chr(13)) Sleep(50) sendkeys('AAABAAAA') Sendkeys(Chr(13)) Sleep(50) Writeln('AAAABAAA') Sendkeys(Chr(13)) Sleep(50) sendkeys('AAAAABAA') Sendkeys(Chr(13)) Sleep(50) sendkeys('AAAAAABA') Sendkeys(Chr(13)) Sleep(50) sendkeys('AAAAAAAB') Until(false) end.[/quote]

-.- I want all the letter combinations. But thanks for trying.

Read full topic

item.title: Easiest way to
item.dc:creator: @SCOTTY1 -SCOTTY-
item.description:

Here ya go just select the window and press play

item.title: Easiest way to
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Use SCAR.

Get it to right into a Text file. Set the letters to Integer values, and get it to send them to the Text file, and have the Integer values increase, changing what the letter is each rotation.

Definetly not the fastest way though…

Read full topic
